intro: Tetrapterys xylosteifolia, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in coastal areas and mangrove ecosystems. The plant is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and shows a preference for brackish or saline water. It plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms. Its botanical features make it well adapted to the challenging conditions of estuarine environments.
